Name: ![](./Items/Artifact - Glowing Artifact.png)Glowing Artifact
Description: A divine looking Artifact wrapped in glowing glyphs. When kept in the bag; it allows the Pokémon to see beyond fog and darkness.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Cheri Berry.png)Cheri Berry
Description: This bright red Berry is very spicy and has a provocative flavor. It blooms with delicate; pretty flowers. It cures Paralysis when eaten.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Chesto Berry.png)Chesto Berry
Description: This Berry's thick skin and fruit are very tough and dry tasting. However; every bit of it can be eaten. It cures Sleep when eaten.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Pecha Berry.png)Pecha Berry
Description: Because of its hollow inside pocket; there isn't a lot to eat. What can be eaten is very sweet and delicious. It cures Poisoned and Badly Poisoned when eaten.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Rawst Berry.png)Rawst Berry
Description: If the leaves grow longer and curlier than average; this Berry will have a somewhat-bitter taste. It cures a Burn when eaten.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Aspear Berry.png)Aspear Berry
Description: This Berry's peel is hard; but the flesh inside is very juicy. It is distinguished by its bracing sourness. Eaten when frozen to thaw out. Make sure it's equipped first!

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Leppa Berry.png)Leppa Berry
Description: It's quite popular; although it takes a lot of time and care to grow. The smaller Berries taste better. It can be eaten to restore a move's PP by 10.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Oran Berry.png)Oran Berry
Description: Nature's gifts came together as one in this incredibly healthy Berry. It has a wondrous mix of flavors that spread in the mouth. It restores 100 HP.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Oren Berry.png)Oren Berry
Description: Lookalike item for the Oran Berry. An Oran Berry with a blue stem instead of white. Instead of healing the user; it deals 10 damage. Be careful!

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Persim Berry.png)Persim Berry
Description: The more this berry absorbs energy from sunlight; the more vividly colorful it grows. It cures a Confusion when eaten.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Lum Berry.png)Lum Berry
Description: This Berry's gradual process of storing nutrients beneficial to Pokémon health causes it to mature slowly. It cures all status problems.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Sitrus Berry.png)Sitrus Berry
Description: Somehow came from the same family as Oran. It is larger and smoother tasting. Some Pokemon call it miraculous. It fully restores all HP when eaten.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Figy Berry.png)Figy Berry
Description: This Berry is oddly shaped; appearing as if someone took a bite out of it. It is packed full of spicy substances. It restores 300 HP when eaten. Confuses Pokémon that dislike spicy flavor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Wiki Berry.png)Wiki Berry
Description: It is said that this Berry grew lumps to help Pokémon grip it; allowing propagation farther afield. It restores 300 HP when eaten. Confuses Pokémon that dislike dry flavor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Mago Berry.png)Mago Berry
Description: This Berry progressively curves as it grows. The curvier the Berry; the sweeter and tastier. It restores 300 HP when eaten. Confuses Pokémon that dislike sweet flavor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Aguav Berry.png)Aguav Berry
Description: This Berry turns bitter toward the stem. The dainty flower it grows from doesn't absorb much sunlight. It restores 300 HP when eaten. Confuses Pokémon that dislike bitter flavor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Iapapa Berry.png)Iapapa Berry
Description: This Berry is very big and sour. The juiciness of the pulp accentuates the sourness. It restores 300 HP when eaten. Confuses Pokémon that dislike sour flavor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Razz Berry.png)Razz Berry
Description: A small hint of spiciness lingers in the red granules surrounding this Berry. Their centers have a dry taste. If thrown at a Pokemon before throwing an Apricorn; they'll be much more likely to join.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Bluk Berry.png)Bluk Berry
Description: Though this small; delicately skinned Berry is blue in color; it dyes the mouth black when eaten. If thrown at a Pokemon before throwing an Apricorn; they will level up right after joining.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Nanab Berry.png)Nanab Berry
Description: Bitter; but with a trace of sweetness; the Nanab Berry was one of the very first to be discovered in the world. If thrown at a Pokemon before throwing an Apricorn; they'll be Immobilized in case of failure.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Wepear Berry.png)Wepear Berry
Description: The potent mix of bitter and sour in this Berry seems to promote digestion. The flower is white and beautiful. If thrown at a Pokemon before throwing an Apricorn; they'll be fully healed after joining.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Pinap Berry.png)Pinap Berry
Description: It is said that when the sour skin is peeled; this spicy Berry can be crushed to make medicine. If thrown at a Pokemon before throwing an Apricorn; they'll start with higher Connection when joining.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Pomeg Berry.png)Pomeg Berry
Description: When this sweetly spicy Berry's thick skin is peeled; many pieces of the fruit spill out. Drops HP by 1 stage; but increases Connection and IQ by 1.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Kelpsy Berry.png)Kelpsy Berry
Description: This Berry can be eaten as is or boiled to obtain an extract that adds a dash of flavor to food. Drops Attack by 1 stage; but increases Connection and IQ by 1.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Qualot Berry.png)Qualot Berry
Description: Even in places of constant rain and high humidity; this Berry's plant grows healthy and strong. Drops Defense by 1 stage; but increases Connection and IQ by 1.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Hondew Berry.png)Hondew Berry
Description: This somewhat-rare Berry projects an image of luxury; so it is favored as a gift item. Drops Special Attack by 1 stage; but increases Connection and IQ by 1.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Grepa Berry.png)Grepa Berry
Description: One bite of this very tender Berry fills the mouth with its sweet and tangy flavor. Drops Special Defense by 1 stage; but increases Connection and IQ by 1.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Tamato Berry.png)Tamato Berry
Description: This Berry is large and spicy. If made into a sauce during the cold season; it warms and heals the body from inside. It's quite expensive and sought after. Drops Speed by 1 stage; but increases Connection and IQ by 1.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Cornn Berry.png)Cornn Berry
Description: Its dryness is quite strong. As a result; its true deliciousness can't be appreciated by just eating one or two. It's quite expensive and sought after. Drops Crit Chance by 1 stage; but increases Connection and IQ by 1.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Magost Berry.png)Magost Berry
Description: The grown-up flavor and dreamy sweetness of this Berry make it a favorite of Pokémon everywhere. It's quite expensive and sought after. Drops Accuracy by 1 stage; but increases Connection and IQ by 1.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Rabuta Berry.png)Rabuta Berry
Description: Even though it is bitter; it should be eaten peel and all. The hair on the peel cleans the stomach from the inside. It's quite expensive and sought after. Drops Evasion by 1 stage; but increases Connection and IQ by 1.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Nomel Berry.png)Nomel Berry
Description: This Berry is quite sour overall; with the sourness especially concentrated at the pointed end. It's quite expensive and sought after. Drops a random stat by 1 stage; but increases Connection and IQ by 1.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Spelon Berry.png)Spelon Berry
Description: So spicy is the Spelon Berry that; Fire type or not; Pokémon will try to breathe fire after eating a single one. It's quite expensive and sought after.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Pamtre Berry.png)Pamtre Berry
Description: Drifts on the sea from somewhere. It is thought to grow elsewhere. It's quite expensive and sought after.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Watmel Berry.png)Watmel Berry
Description: A bounty of nature that is exceedingly sweet. This Berry's sheer size makes it perfect for sharing. It's quite expensive and sought after.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Durin Berry.png)Durin Berry
Description: This Berry is tremendously bitter. Just one bite is enough to instantly stop hiccups. It's quite expensive and sought after.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Belue Berry.png)Belue Berry
Description: This glossy and colorful Berry has a mouthwateringly delicious appearance. However; it is awfully sour. It's quite expensive and sought after.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Occa Berry.png)Occa Berry
Description: This berry is said to have grown plentiful in the tropics of the past. It boasts an intensely hot spiciness. It changes the Pokémon to the Fire type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Passho Berry.png)Passho Berry
Description: This berry's flesh is dotted with tiny bubbles of air that keep it afloat in water. It changes the Pokémon to the Water type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Wacan Berry.png)Wacan Berry
Description: Energy from lightning strikes is drawn into the plant; making the berries grow big and rich. It changes the Pokémon to the Electric type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Rindo Berry.png)Rindo Berry
Description: This berry has a disagreeable "green" flavor and scent typical of vegetables. It is rich in health-promoting fiber. It changes the Pokémon to the Grass type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Yache Berry.png)Yache Berry
Description: This berry has a refreshing flavor that strikes a good balance of dryness and sourness. It tastes better chilled. It changes the Pokémon to the Ice type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Chople Berry.png)Chople Berry
Description: This berry contains a substance that generates heat. It can even heat up a chilly heart. It changes the Pokémon to the Fighting type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Kebia Berry.png)Kebia Berry
Description: This berry is a brilliant green on the outside. Inside; it is packed with a dry-flavored; black-colored flesh. It changes the Pokémon to the Poison type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Shuca Berry.png)Shuca Berry
Description: The sweetness-laden pulp has just the hint of a hard-edged and fragrant bite to it. It changes the Pokémon to the Ground type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Coba Berry.png)Coba Berry
Description: This berry is said to be a new kind that is a cross of two berries brought together by winds from far away. It changes the Pokémon to the Flying type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Payapa Berry.png)Payapa Berry
Description: This berry is said to sense emotions for the way it swells roundly when anything approaches. It changes the Pokémon to the Psychic type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Tanga Berry.png)Tanga Berry
Description: The flower grows at the tip of this berry. It attracts Bug Pokémon by letting its stringy petals stream out. It changes the Pokémon to the Bug type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Charti Berry.png)Charti Berry
Description: It is often used for pickles because of its very dry flavor. It can also be eaten raw for its provocative taste. It changes the Pokémon to the Rock type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Kasib Berry.png)Kasib Berry
Description: Considered to have a special power from the olden days; this berry is sometimes dried and used as a good-luck charm. It changes the Pokémon to the Ghost type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Haban Berry.png)Haban Berry
Description: If a large enough volume of this berry is boiled down; its bitterness fades away. It makes a good jam. It changes the Pokémon to the Dragon type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Colbur Berry.png)Colbur Berry
Description: Tiny hooks grow on the surface of this berry. It latches on to Pokémon so it can be carried to far-off places. It changes the Pokémon to the Dark type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Babiri Berry.png)Babiri Berry
Description: This berry is very tough with a strong flavor. It was used to make medicine in the past. It changes the Pokémon to the Steel type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Roseli Berry.png)Roseli Berry
Description: A shockingly sweet berry that makes the most rigid hearts melt. It's a great juice ingredient. It changes the Pokémon to the Fairy type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Chilan Berry.png)Chilan Berry
Description: This berry can be cored out and dried to make a whistle. Blowing through its hole makes an eye-tearing sound. It changes the Pokémon to the Normal type through the rest of the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Chiliad Berry.png)Chiliad Berry
Description: A lookalike item for the Chiliad Berry. It causes a hostile Deoxys to warp next to the Pokemon eating it! But why!?

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Liechi Berry.png)Liechi Berry
Description: This Berry is surrounded by mystery. It is rumored to be imbued with the power of the sea. It raises Attack by 3 stages.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Ganlon Berry.png)Ganlon Berry
Description: This Berry is surrounded by mystery. It is rumored to be imbued with the power of the land. It raises Defense by 3 stages.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Salac Berry.png)Salac Berry
Description: This Berry is surrounded by mystery. It is rumored to be imbued with the power of the sky. It raises Speed by 3 stages.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Petaya Berry.png)Petaya Berry
Description: This Berry is surrounded by mystery. It is rumored to be imbued with the power of all living things. It raises Special Attack by 3 stages.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Apicot Berry.png)Apicot Berry
Description: This is a very; very mystifying Berry. There is no telling how it can be used; or what may happen if it is used. It raises Special Defense by 3 stages.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Lansat Berry.png)Lansat Berry
Description: This is said to be a legendary Berry. Holding it supposedly brings great joy. It raises Crit Chance by 3 stages.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Starf Berry.png)Starf Berry
Description: This berry is still considered a mirage to this very day. It was said to be so strong that it had to be abandoned at the world's edge. It raises all stats by 1 stage.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Enigma Berry.png)Enigma Berry
Description: A completely enigmatic Berry. It apparently has the power of the stars that fill the night sky. What could be synthesized from it...?

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Edigma Berry.png)Edigma Berry
Description: A lookalike item for the Enigma Berry. When eaten; it allows the Pokemon to use Dig!

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Micle Berry.png)Micle Berry
Description: This berry has a very dry flavor. It has the effect of making other food eaten at the same time taste sweet. It raises Crit Chance to the max.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Custap Berry.png)Custap Berry
Description: The flesh underneath the Custap Berry's tough skin is sweet and creamy soft. It gives the Protect status when eaten.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Jaboca Berry.png)Jaboca Berry
Description: The cluster of drupelets that make up this berry pop rhythmically if the berry is handled roughly. It gives the Counter status when eaten.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Rowap Berry.png)Rowap Berry
Description: In days of old; people worked the top-shaped pieces of this berry free and used them as toys. It gives the Special Counter status when eaten.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Kee Berry.png)Kee Berry
Description: You'll be hit first by its burning spiciness; then its extreme bitterness. Its patterns grow as it ripens. It gives the Reflect status when eaten.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Maranga Berry.png)Maranga Berry
Description: Its outside is very bitter; but its inside tastes like a sweet drink. It has a really strong and tingly scent. It gives the Light Screen status when eaten.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Pumkin Berry.png)Pumkin Berry
Description: An extremely rare Berry synthesized from the Enigma Berry. This Berry is amazingly sour. It's heavy due to its dense filling. It gives Freeze immunity when eaten; until the end of the whole dungeon.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Drash Berry.png)Drash Berry
Description: An extremely rare Berry synthesized from the Enigma Berry. It gives Poison immunity when eaten; until the end of the whole dungeon.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Eggant Berry.png)Eggant Berry
Description: An extremely rare Berry synthesized from the Enigma Berry. It gives Infatuation immunity when eaten; until the end of the whole dungeon.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Strib Berry.png)Strib Berry
Description: An extremely rare Berry synthesized from the Enigma Berry. It gives Terrified immunity when eaten; until the end of the whole dungeon.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Nutpea Berry.png)Nutpea Berry
Description: An extremely rare Berry synthesized from the Enigma Berry. It gives Petrify immunity when eaten; until the end of the whole dungeon.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Ginema Berry.png)Ginema Berry
Description: An extremely rare Berry synthesized from the Enigma Berry. It gives immunity to stats lowering when eaten; until the end of the whole dungeon.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Kuo Berry.png)Kuo Berry
Description: An extremely rare Berry synthesized from the Enigma Berry. It gives Paralysis immunity when eaten; until the end of the whole dungeon.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Yago Berry.png)Yago Berry
Description: An extremely rare Berry synthesized from the Enigma Berry. It gives Burn immunity when eaten; until the end of the whole dungeon.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Touga Berry.png)Touga Berry
Description: An extremely rare Berry synthesized from the Enigma Berry. It gives Confusion immunity when eaten; until the end of the whole dungeon.

Name: ![](./Items/Berry - Niniku Berry.png)Niniku Berry
Description: An extremely rare Berry synthesized from the Enigma Berry. It gives Sleep immunity when eaten; until the end of the whole dungeon.

Description: A curious scarf that boosts Crit Chance by 2 stages; but only allows the use of one move each floor.

Description: Lookalike Item for Choice Ribbon. Equipping this will make it disappear; a Primeape will appear in front of user; and user'll have to choose between giving him a Chestnut or battling!

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Twist Band.png)Twist Band
Description: A twisty band that prevents the Pokémon's Attack and Special Attack from being reduced.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Munch Belt.png)Munch Belt
Description: A rare belt that boosts the Pokémon's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage but also makes the Pokémon's Belly go down faster.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Diet Ribbon.png)Diet Ribbon
Description: A slimming ribbon that empties the Pokémon's Belly faster and prevents it from being filled.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Stamina Band.png)Stamina Band
Description: A survival band that slows how quickly the Pokémon's Belly goes down.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Tight Belt.png)Tight Belt
Description: A squeezing belt that prevents the Belly from going down by standing still.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Right Belt.png)Right Belt
Description: Lookalike item for Tight Belt. With this equipped; user can only move right!

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Coalition Scarf.png)Coalition Scarf
Description: A unifying scarf. Team Attacks and Alliances don't deplete the holder's belly; as if Connection was maxed.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Pass Scarf.png)Pass Scarf
Description: A shifting scarf that causes the Pokémon to shrug off any move and pass it on to a random adjacent Pokémon; but only if they have more HP than the holder. Teammates can be hit too!

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Pierce Band.png)Pierce Band
Description: A sharp band that makes the Pokémon's thrown items pierce through all targets; walls and obstacles without stopping. It has no effect on thrown rocks.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Curve Band.png)Curve Band
Description: A curvy band that makes thrown items bounce off walls and fly sideways along walls. It has no effect if the Pokémon has a Pierce status or if throws a rock.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Dodge Scarf.png)Dodge Scarf
Description: An elusive scarf that prevents any thrown item from hitting the Pokémon.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Bounce Band.png)Bounce Band
Description: A rubberized band that makes thrown items bounce straight back from the Pokémon.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Focus Band.png)Focus Band
Description: A reinvigorating band that gives the holder a 10% chance to survive any damage at 1 HP.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Focus Sash.png)Focus Sash
Description: A reinvigorating sash that gives the holder the ability to survive any single-hit attack at 1 HP if at max HP.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Fickle Ribbon.png)Fickle Ribbon
Description: It boosts the critical-hit rate by 1 stage if the holder uses a move it didn't use the turn before.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Nickel Ribbon.png)Nickel Ribbon
Description: Lookalike item for Fickle Ribbon. Equipping this will scatter all your held ₽ to the floor when you use a move!

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Lucky Ribbon.png)Lucky Ribbon
Description: A fortunate ribbon that makes the holder immune to critical hits; even from teammates.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Patsy Band.png)Patsy Band
Description: A foolish band that increases the Pokémon's chances of taking critical hits. There must be a use case for this...

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Binding Band.png)Binding Band
Description: A round band that increases the power of binding moves used by the holder.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Muscle Band.png)Muscle Band
Description: A band for the toughest. Boosts the damage of physical moves used by the holder by 50%; but doesn't increase Attack.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Muscle Belt.png)Muscle Belt
Description: A belt for the toughest. Boosts the damage of special moves used by the holder by 50%; but doesn't increase Special Attack.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Expert Belt.png)Expert Belt
Description: A well-worn belt that boosts the power of super-effective moves by 50%

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Mobile Scarf.png)Mobile Scarf
Description: A light scarf that enables the Pokémon to move and attack through walls and move on inhospitable terrain; such as magma; in exchange for Belly.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Melee Band.png)Melee Band
Description: A familiar band that launches nearby foes away if the holder falls asleep.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Racket Band.png)Racket Band
Description: A noisy band that helps awaken sleeping Pokémon enemies.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Sneak Scarf.png)Sneak Scarf
Description: A stealthy scarf that prevents the Pokémon from awakening sleeping enemies.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Destiny Knot.png)Destiny Knot
Description: A hypnotizing ball of yarn... Infatuates opposing Pokémon when holder is inflicted with infatuation.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Shed Shell.png)Shed Shell
Description: A carapace that prevents the holder from being immobilized or petrified.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Reflex Band.png)Reflex Band
Description: A reflecting band that gives the holder 10% chance of getting Mini Counter status when taking damage.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Substitute Scarf.png)Substitute Scarf
Description: A plushy scarf that prevents the first damage taken from a wild Pokemon from exceeding 25% Max HP.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Forewarn Scarf.png)Forewarn Scarf
Description: A foreboding scarf that prevents teammates from doing damage to the holder.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Reunion Cape.png)Reunion Cape
Description: When the holder gets separated from user; it will warp near user. If the user holds it; they'll warp near their teammate when they get separated.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Cover Band.png)Cover Band
Description: A wide band. When a Pokémon with low HP is nearby; the holder takes damage instead.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Joy Ribbon.png)Joy Ribbon
Description: A glorious ribbon that earns the Pokémon Experience equal to the damage taken.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Friend Bow.png)Friend Bow
Description: A heartwarming bow. Newly recruited Pokemon start with 10 IQ! Increases recruit chance by 10%

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Macho Brace.png)Macho Brace
Description: A tough brace that allows the holder to gain 10% more experience; but has halved Speed.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Heal Ribbon.png)Heal Ribbon
Description: A therapeutic ribbon that speeds up the Pokémon's natural HP healing.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - Trap Scarf.png)Trap Scarf
Description: A defusing scarf that prevents traps from activating when the Pokémon steps on them.

Name: ![](./Items/Cloth Equipment - No Stick Cap.png)No Stick Cap

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Emera Up Orb.png)Emera Up Orb
Description: Using it adds 1 notch for an emera to a looplet. But the notch is available only until the end of the dungeon.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Enemy Discord Orb.png)Enemy Discord Orb
Description: Using it creates the Enemy Discord condition on the floor and makes enemy Pokémon unable to use Connections; Alliances or Team Attacks.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Enemy Evolve Orb.png)Enemy Evolve Orb
Description: Using it evolves enemy Pokémon in the same room; but it has no effect on the Pokemon's teammates.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Enemy Devolve Orb.png)Enemy Devolve Orb
Description: Using it devolves enemy Pokémon in the same room; but it has no effect on the Pokemon's teammates.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Escape Orb.png)Escape Orb
Description: An escape item that instantly warps the team out of the dungeon to safety.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Evasion Orb.png)Evasion Orb
Description: A stat-boosting item that raises the user's evasiveness by 2 stages.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Fill In Orb.png)Fill In Orb
Description: An orb that fills in all holes on the floor; removing all holes; gullies; water; or lava.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Petrify Orb.png)Petrify Orb
Description: An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Petrified status condition.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Foe Hold Orb.png)Foe Hold Orb
Description: An item that afflicts all enemies on the entire floor with a Petrified status condition.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Foe Fear Orb.png)Foe Fear Orb
Description: An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Terrified status condition.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Foe Seal Orb.png)Foe Seal Orb
Description: An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Paused status condition.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Hail Orb.png)Hail Orb
Description: A climate-control item that changes the dungeon floor's weather to a Hail condition.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Health Orb.png)Health Orb
Description: Using it heals bad status conditions; resets lowered stats of the Pokemon's party; and makes the Pokemon's party healthy. Being healthy prevents bad status conditions or a reduction in stats.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Hurl Orb.png)Hurl Orb
Description: A weapon item that hurls the target toward a random enemy Pokémon to inflict 10 damage.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Identify Orb.png)Identify Orb
Description: A sensor item that indicates on the map if the Pokémon on the floor are holding items or not.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Invisify Orb.png)Invisify Orb
Description: An item that temporarily gives the user's team an Invisible status. A Pokémon with the Invisible status is cloaked from view.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Itemizer Orb.png)Itemizer Orb
Description: A horrifying orb that turns the target Pokemon into an item. If it rebounds the user will be turned into an item; so make sure you have a Reviver Seed on hand!

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Lasso Orb.png)Lasso Orb
Description: Gathers and immobilizes enemy Pokémon in the same room into one place.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Lob Orb.png)Lob Orb
Description: A weapon item that inflicts damage on any Pokémon in an X pattern; passing through walls.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Longtoss Orb.png)Longtoss Orb
Description: An item that gives Long Toss status to the user; which makes any item thrown by the user fly until it hits a wall or a Pokémon. It has no effect on thrown rocks.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Luminous Orb.png)Luminous Orb
Description: A mapping item that reveals the entire floor layout to the user.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Mobile Orb.png)Mobile Orb
Description: An item that gives a Mobile status to the user. A Pokémon with Mobile can move through walls and gullies and walk on lava and water.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Monster Orb.png)Monster Orb
Description: Using it changes the room to a Monster House. Make sure you're well equipped!

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Mug Orb.png)Mug Orb
Description: A weapon item that inflicts 10 damage on the target; even at a distance. It also steals the target's hold item and makes it the user's. This added affect works only if the user is not holding an item.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Nullify Orb.png)Nullify Orb
Description: Using it nullifies the Abilities of enemy Pokémon on the entire floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Observer Orb.png)Observer Orb
Description: Changes the status of the target to Paused; making it incapable of action.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - One Room Orb.png)One Room Orb
Description: A destructive item that tears down all walls on the floor; turning the floor into one vast; open room. This might trigger Monster Houses so be careful!

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - One Broom Orb.png)One Broom Orb
Description: Lookalike Item for One-Room Orb. Using this will spawn a broom that will sweep away every item from the entire floor!

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - One Shot Orb.png)One Shot Orb
Description: A weapon item that has a 10% chance of instantly defeating the target in one shot. It doesn't seem to work on Legendary or Mythical Pokemon....

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Pierce Orb.png)Pierce Orb
Description: An item that gives Pierce status to the user; which makes any item thrown pierce through walls and all Pokémon it hits without stopping.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Possess Orb.png)Possess Orb
Description: Using this orb gives the whole team the Destiny Bond status.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Pounce Orb.png)Pounce Orb
Description: An item that makes the user pounce towards the first Pokémon in its line of sight; no matter how distant. If there are no Pokémon in that direction; the user leaps to the wall.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Quick Orb.png)Quick Orb
Description: An item that boosts the Speed of the user and team members in the room by 1 stage.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Radar Orb.png)Radar Orb
Description: A sensory item that reveals the location of all enemies on the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Rainy Orb.png)Rainy Orb
Description: A climate-control item that changes the dungeon floor's weather to a Rain condition.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Rebound Orb.png)Rebound Orb
Description: An item that changes the user's status to Mini Counter; which enables the user to make certain types of moves and enemy attacks rebound; returning part of the damage

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Revive All Orb.png)Revive All Orb
Description: Using it revives all of the Pokemon's fainted teammates.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Reviver Orb.png)Reviver Orb
Description: Functions exactly like a Reviver Seed; but it cannot be accidentally eaten; not even by enemy Pokemon. Phew!

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Rocky Orb.png)Rocky Orb
Description: A weapon item that inflicts 30 damage on the target. It also reduces the target's Movement Speed by 1 level.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Rollcall Orb.png)Rollcall Orb
Description: A warping item that draws all team members to the user.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Sandy Orb.png)Sandy Orb
Description: A climate-control item that changes the dungeon floor's weather to a Sanstorm condition.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Scanner Orb.png)Scanner Orb
Description: A sensory item that reveals the location of all items on the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - See Trap Orb.png)See Trap Orb
Description: A sensory item that reveals all hidden traps in the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Shocker Orb.png)Shocker Orb
Description: An item that afflicts a distant target with a Cowering status condition. A Pokémon with the Cowering status will find that its attacks go in the opposite direction on its aim.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Silence Orb.png)Silence Orb
Description: An item that afflicts a distant target with a Muzzled status condition. A Pokémon with the Muzzled status is incapable of using moves or items that require the use of its mouth.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Sizebust Orb.png)Sizebust Orb
Description: A weapon item that inflicts damage on the target. The bigger the target's size; the greater the damage.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Slow Orb.png)Slow Orb
Description: A status item that reduces the Movement Speed of all enemies in the room by 1 level.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Slumber Orb.png)Slumber Orb
Description: An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Sleep status condition. A Pokémon that has a Sleep status is incapable of action.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Snatch Orb.png)Snatch Orb
Description: An item that gives Snatch status to the user. This status lets the user steal the effects of all moves used by Pokémon on the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Spurn Orb.png)Spurn Orb
Description: An item that warps all enemies in the room to random locations on the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Spun Orb.png)Spun Orb
Description: Lookalike item for Spurn Orb. Using this will create a Spin Trap underneath the user!

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Stairs Orb.png)Stairs Orb
Description: A sensory item that shows the location of the floor's stairway.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Stayaway Orb.png)Stayaway Orb
Description: An item that afflicts an enemy in the user's line of sight with a Petrified status; then warps it on the floor's stairs.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Sunny Orb.png)Sunny Orb
Description: A climate-control item that changes the dungeon floor's weather to a Sunny condition.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Surround Orb.png)Surround Orb
Description: It draws the Pokemon's teammates around the leader.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Switcher Orb.png)Switcher Orb
Description: An item that makes a distant Pokémon switch places with the user.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Toss Orb.png)Toss Orb
Description: Equipping this item forces the holder to waste a turn to throw it. They can't resist...

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Totter Orb.png)Totter Orb
Description: An item that afflicts all enemies in the room with a Confused status condition. A Pokémon with the Confused status condition will find that its movements and attacks go astray.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Transfer Orb.png)Transfer Orb
Description: An item that transforms the target into a different Pokémon.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Trapper Orb.png)Trapper Orb
Description: An item that sets a trap on the user's tile. The type of trap is randomly determined.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Trawl Orb.png)Trawl Orb
Description: An item that pulls all items on the floor to the user. It can't pull items from a shop though.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Two Edge Orb.png)Two Edge Orb
Description: An attack item that cuts the HP of all enemies in the room to just 1 HP. But the same will happen to the Pokemon's whole team! It doesn't seem to work on Legendary or Mythical Pokemon...

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Warp Orb.png)Warp Orb
Description: An item that warps a distant Pokémon to a different spot on the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - All Aim Orb.png)All Aim Orb
Description: An orb that raises the whole team's accuracy by 1 stage.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Endure Orb.png)Endure Orb
Description: An orb that allows the team to endure any attack with at least 1 HP.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Freeze Orb.png)Freeze Orb
Description: An orb that freezes all enemies in the same room.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Halving Orb.png)Halving Orb
Description: An orb that halves the HP of all enemies in the same room. It doesn't seem to affect Legendary or Mythical Pokemon...

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Invert Orb.png)Invert Orb
Description: An orb that temporarily reverses all type matchups.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Mirror Orb.png)Mirror Orb
Description: An orb that protects the team with a barrier that reflects status moves.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Trapbust Orb.png)Trapbust Orb
Description: An orb that destroys all traps on the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Orb - Weather Orb.png)Weather Orb
Description: A climate-control orb that changes the dungeon floor's condition depending on the user's type.

Name: ![](./Items/Roto Powers - Roto Hatch.png)Roto Hatch
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Makes Pokemon Eggs hatch 10% faster for a day.

Name: ![](./Items/Roto Powers - Roto Bargain.png)Roto Bargain
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Reduces the prices of products at Kecleon Shop by 10% for a day.

Name: ![](./Items/Roto Powers - Roto Prize.png)Roto Prize
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Increases the amount of ₽ found by 10% for a day.

Name: ![](./Items/Roto Powers - Roto Experience.png)Roto Experience
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Increases the Exp. Points the team receives in battle by 10% for a day.

Name: ![](./Items/Roto Powers - Roto Friendship.png)Roto Friendship
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Temporarily increases Connection with the team by 10 for a day.

Name: ![](./Items/Roto Powers - Roto Encounter.png)Roto Encounter
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Increases the chance of encountering high-level wild Pokémon for a day.

Name: ![](./Items/Roto Powers - Roto Stealth.png)Roto Stealth
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Increases the chance of encountering low-level wild Pokémon for a day.

Name: ![](./Items/Roto Powers - Roto HP .png)Roto HP
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Doubles the natural HP regeneration for a day.

Name: ![](./Items/Roto Powers - Roto PP .png)Roto PP
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Increases the max PP of moves by 50% for a day.

Name: ![](./Items/Roto Powers - Roto Boost.png)Roto Boost
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Raises a random stat by 1 stage for a day.

Name: ![](./Items/Roto Powers - Roto Catch.png)Roto Catch
Description: A reality shifting; consumable charm. Increases the chances to recruit a Pokemon with an Apricorn by 10% for a day.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Electric Seed.png)Electric Seed
Description: When held; Consumed on Electric Terrain and raises the holder's Defense by one stage.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Psychic Seed.png)Psychic Seed
Description: When held; Consumed on Psychic Terrain and raises the holder's Special Defense by one stage.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Misty Seed.png)Misty Seed
Description: When held; Consumed on Misty Terrain and raises the holder's Special Defense by one stage.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Grassy Seed.png)Grassy Seed
Description: When held; Consumed on Grassy Terrain and raises the holder's Defense by one stage.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Ban Seed.png)Ban Seed
Description: Eating it causes all Pokemon on the floor to have the user's last move disabled.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Blast Seed.png)Blast Seed
Description: Eating it makes the user attack 1 tile in front of user with a blast; causing 100 damage!

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Doom Seed.png)Doom Seed
Description: Throwing it at a Pokemon lowers their level by 1. Don't miss because wild Pokemon can do the same!

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Dough Seed.png)Dough Seed
Description: It is a Lookalike Item for the Doom Seed. Eating it makes more ₽ appear on the next floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Encourage Seed.png)Encourage Seed
Description: Eating it gives user the Encouraged status.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Energy Seed.png)Energy Seed
Description: Eating it fully restores the Pokemon's HP; and temporarily increases the Pokemon's Max HP by 10!

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Eyedrop Seed.png)Eyedrop Seed
Description: Eating it cures the Blinker status and gives user the Eyedrops status.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Dropeye Seed.png)Dropeye Seed
Description: It is a Lookalike Item for the Eyedrop Seed. A food item that gives the Dropeye status; where the immediate surrounding area will be dark; even in rooms.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Famous Seed.png)Famous Seed
Description: A Plain Seed... but unlike other Plain Seeds; it's very sought after for some reason.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Golden Seed.png)Golden Seed
Description: It's one of the Golden Items; with a golden glow. They say eating it boosts the Pokemon's level by 3.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Heal Seed.png)Heal Seed
Description: A healthy seed; eating it removes any and all status conditions.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Hunger Seed.png)Hunger Seed
Description: Eating it depletes the Pokemon's Belly by 10... there must be a use case for this.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Joy Seed.png)Joy Seed
Description: A delicious seed that increases the Pokemon's level by 1.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Life Seed.png)Life Seed
Description: A healthy seed that permanently increases the Pokemon's Max HP by 1.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Plain Seed.png)Plain Seed
Description: Eating it has no particular effect. It's really an ordinary seed.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Pure Seed.png)Pure Seed
Description: A seed that warps the Pokémon close to the stairs.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Quick Seed.png)Quick Seed
Description: Eating it boosts the Pokemon's Movement Speed for a little while.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Tiny Reviver Seed.png)Tiny Reviver Seed
Description: Eating it has no particular effect; but if a Pokemon faints with one; it revives them with 1 HP; then turns into a Plain Seed.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Reviver Seed.png)Reviver Seed
Description: Eating it has no particular effect; but if a Pokemon faints with one; it revives them with fully restored HP; PP; and Belly; then turns into a Plain Seed.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Reviser Seed.png)Reviser Seed
Description: It is a Lookalike Item for the Reviver Seed. But what does it do when the user faints...?

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Max Reviver Seed.png)Max Reviver Seed
Description: Eating it has no particular effect; but if a Pokemon faints with one; it revives them with fully restored HP; PP; and Belly; heals all negative status conditions and preserves positive ones; eliminates stat debuffs and preserves buffs; then turns into a Plain Seed.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Sleep Seed.png)Sleep Seed
Description: Throwing it at a Pokemon puts them to Sleep.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Slip Seed.png)Slip Seed
Description: It is a Lookalike Item for the Sleep Seed. Eating it gives the Slip status; where it is possible to walk on water.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Soothing Seed.png)Soothing Seed
Description: Eating it resets all stats back to normal.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Stun Seed.png)Stun Seed
Description: Throwing it at a Pokemon causes them to be Petrified.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Totter Seed.png)Totter Seed
Description: Throwing it at a Pokemon causes them to be Confused.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Training Seed.png)Training Seed
Description: Eating it gives user the Training condition; which boosts the growth of moves.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Vanish Seed.png)Vanish Seed
Description: Eating it gives user the Invisible condition.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Violent Seed.png)Violent Seed
Description: A mysterious seed; imbued with shadow energy... eating it raises the Pokemon's Attack and Special Attack to the absolute maximum! But then...?

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Warp Seed.png)Warp Seed
Description: Eating it warps user to a different place on the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - X Eye Seed.png)X Eye Seed
Description: Throwing it at a Pokemon gives them the Cross Eyed status.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Blinker Seed.png)Blinker Seed
Description: A seed that gives the Blinker status.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Decoy Seed.png)Decoy Seed
Description: A seed that gives the Pokémon the Decoy status; making it a target of everyone's attacks. Enemy moves that target the team's inventory will always pick this item first.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Ice Seed.png)Ice Seed
Description: A seed that freezes the Pokémon for many turns.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Last Chance Seed.png)Last Chance Seed
Description: A seed that sets the PP of the Pokémon's moves to 1; and raises its Attack; Special Attack; and Speed by 3 stages.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Spreader Seed.png)Spreader Seed
Description: A seed that causes the Pokémon to share the effects of moves used on it.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Vile Seed.png)Vile Seed
Description: A seed that lowers the Pokémon's Defense and Special Defense by 3 stages.

Name: ![](./Items/Seed - Via Seed.png)Via Seed
Description: It is a Lookalike Item for the Vile Seed. Eating it causes user to say ''See Ya!'' and warp to a random room!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Wonder Tile.png)Wonder Tile
Description: Standing on this tile will resets all the Pokemon's stat changes. Even positive ones!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Barrage Tile.png)Barrage Tile
Description: While standing on this tile; the user can use a move two times in a row in one turn! The move's PP will be reduced as if the Pokemon used it two times.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Dodge Tile.png)Dodge Tile
Description: While on this tile; the Pokemon can dodge moves more easily!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Heal Tile.png)Heal Tile
Description: While on this tile; bad statuses won't affect the Pokemon!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Pierce Tile.png)Pierce Tile
Description: Throw items while on this tile; and they will go through both enemies and walls; continuing on forever!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Taunt Tile.png)Taunt Tile
Description: While on this tile; the Pokemon can't use status moves. However; the Pokemon's damaging attacks will become more powerful.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Weight Tile.png)Weight Tile
Description: The heavier the Pokémon on this tile is; the better chance it will have at landing critical hits when attacking an enemy!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Mystery Tile.png)Mystery Tile
Description: Looks like a switch... it's a mystery what it will do once it's activated.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Warp Zone.png)Warp Zone
Description: Looks like a Warp Trap; but it actually allows the team to exit a dungeon after a successful exploration.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Rescue Point.png)Rescue Point
Description: Looks like Stairs; but it actually allows the team to exit a dungeon after a successful rescue. Send an A-OK mail to rescue the defeated team.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Apple Trap.png)Apple Trap
Description: Turns a random item in the Bag into an Apple.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Self Destruct Trap.png)Self Destruct Trap
Description: Causes a blast in a 3×3 area that deals 50% HP damage! Items; walls; and tiles within the blast range are destroyed; including this trap. It will fail if it's raining or one of the hit Pokemon has the ability Damp.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Explosion Trap.png)Explosion Trap
Description: Causes a big blast in a 5x5 area that deals 50% HP damage! Items; walls; and tiles within the blast range are destroyed; including this trap. It will fail if it's raining or one of the hit Pokemon has the ability Damp.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Chestnut Trap.png)Chestnut Trap
Description: Drops chestnuts onto the Pokemon; dealing 50% HP damage! However; it also drops a Chestnut. The edible kind.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Discord Trap.png)Discord Trap
Description: Gives the entire party the Discord status condition.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Emera Crush Trap.png)Emera Crush Trap
Description: Destroys an Emera attached to the Pokemon's looplet.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Emera Swap Trap.png)Emera Swap Trap
Description: An emera in the Pokémon's looplet is changed into a different emera.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Grimy Trap.png)Grimy Trap
Description: Triggering this trap makes it spew a muck that gums up food.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Grudge Trap.png)Grudge Trap
Description: Triggering this trap gives the Grudge status to all opposing Pokémon in the area.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Gust Trap.png)Gust Trap
Description: The Pokémon that stepped on it is sent flying 10 squares in any direction. Hitting a wall or Pokémon causes 10 damage.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Hunger Trap.png)Hunger Trap
Description: Reduces Belly by 10.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Mud Trap.png)Mud Trap
Description: Triggering this trap makes it blow mud that lowers the highest stat by 3 stages!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Pitfall Tile.png)Pitfall Tile
Description: When triggered; the entire party falls to the next floor!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - PP Leech Trap.png)PP Leech Trap
Description: Reduces the last used move's PP to 0!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Progress Point.png)Progress Point
Description: A Progress Point tile that allows the team to save their progress in the middle of a Mystery Dungeon!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Progress Point Plus.png)Progress Point Plus
Description: A Progress Point Plus tile that allows the team to save their progress in the middle of a Mystery Dungeon; or even escape from the dungeon without losing any progress!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Random Tile.png)Random Tile
Description: Turns into a random tile when stepped on! Yes; even traps!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Slow Trap.png)Slow Trap
Description: Reduces Movement Speed by 1.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Slumber Trap.png)Slumber Trap
Description: Causes the Sleep status.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Spiked Trap.png)Spiked Trap
Description: Deals 30 damage. This can be created by using the move Spikes!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Stealth Rock Trap.png)Stealth Rock Trap
Description: Deals 15% damage. This can be created by using the move Stealth Rock!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Sticky Trap.png)Sticky Trap
Description: Causes the Pokemon's held item to become sticky. If no item is held; it will make one random item in the inventory sticky. It will also make the pokemon immobilized.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Toxic Spike Trap.png)Toxic Spike Trap
Description: Deals 10 damage and inflicts Poison. This can be created by using the move Toxic Spikes!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Trip Trap.png)Trip Trap
Description: Causes the Pokemon to faceplant and drop the Pokemon's held item! If no held item is held; it will drop a random item in the Pokemon's inventory.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Sealed Door.png)Sealed Door
Description: A door with no lock. Maybe there's a switch somewhere...?

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Sign.png)Sign
Description: A wooden sign. Some gibberish is scribbled on it...

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Stairs.png)Stairs
Description: Stairs leading to the next floor. If user are on the final floor; user will escape from the dungeon.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Secret Stairs.png)Secret Stairs
Description: Stairs leading to an unknown location.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Signal Area.png)Signal Area
Description: A mysterious signal that calls Pokémon to the area.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Compass Tile.png)Compass Tile
Description: A tile that shows the way to important locations on the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Luminous Area.png)Luminous Area
Description: A mysterious area that allows Pokémon to evolve.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Reset Tile.png)Reset Tile
Description: A switch that resets the floor; returning all items; traps; and wild Pokémon to their original positions as if nothing happened.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Switch Tile.png)Switch Tile
Description: A switch that opens various blocked passageways found on the floor.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Training Switch.png)Training Switch
Description: Stepping on this tile gives the Trained status to the party.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Pitfall Trap.png)Pitfall Trap
Description: Stepping on this trap drops the Pokémon to the floor below; inflicting damage.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Poison Trap.png)Poison Trap
Description: Triggering this trap will shoot poison spikes in all directions. Pokémon hit will become poisoned.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Pokémon Trap.png)Pokémon Trap
Description: Triggering this trap transforms all items in the area into hostile Pokémon!

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Seal Trap.png)Seal Trap
Description: Triggering this trap disables the last-used move of all nearby Pokémon.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Spikes.png)Spikes
Description: Stepping on this trap damages the Pokémon standing on it.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Spin Trap.png)Spin Trap
Description: Triggering this trap spins the Pokémon around dizzyingly; making them confused.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Summon Trap.png)Summon Trap
Description: Triggering this trap releases a sweet aroma that attracts Pokémon from afar.

Name: ![](./Items/Tile - Trigger Trap.png)Trigger Trap
